intro: Urceola rosea, commonly known as the pink urn-cup, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its distinctive urn-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Urceola rosea thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its unique floral structure and vibrant color make it a notable species in its native habitat.
